info.description: This is the Swagger version of the OCPI documentation when there are differences between the PDF version and the Swagger version, the PDF version is leading. The goal of these swagger files is to make it easier to implement OCPI. Copyright © 2014 – 2019 NKL. All rights reserved.
info.title: OCPI 2.2 Token eMSP Interface API swagger documentation

license.name: This document is made available under the Creative Commons Attribution- NoDerivatives 4.0 International Public License

tags.name: Tokens module
tags.description: Set of endpoints for get tokens and doing real-time authorization requests

get.summary: Fetch information about Tokens known in the eMSP systems.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Each HTTP request must add an ‘Authorization’ header.

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description: Only return Tokens that have last_updated after this Date/Time.

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description: Only return Tokens that have last_updated before this Date/Time.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of objects to GET.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the first object returned. Default is 0.

post.summary: Do a 'real-time' authorization request to the eMSP system, validating if a Token might be used (at the optionally given Location).

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Each HTTP request must add an ‘Authorization’ header.

data.description: Contains the actual response data object or list of objects from each request, depending on the cardinality of the response data, this is an array (card. * or +), or a single object (card. 1 or ?)

status_code.description: Response code, as listed in Status Codes, indicates how the request was handled. To avoid confusion with HTTP codes, at least four digits are used.

status_message.description: An optional status message which may help when debugging.

status_code.description: Response code, as listed in Status Codes, indicates how the request was handled. To avoid confusion with HTTP codes, at least four digits are used.
